title: The mission which required 25 assists made me queue up for support
body:
Which is when I thought, why don't they make more missions like this so more people are willing to go support?

The objective could be something like; get x vision score, get x assists, apply x seconds of cc, or even make it as simple and direct as "win 5 games as support"
The reward? Chests and key fragments.  I've read a post earlier about how someone got a chest with every support in the game, but they don't play other roles so they can't get anymore chests without buying them. 

Make missions designed to make people queue for support, reward them with chests and key fragments, and this benefits the majority of the player base.

For the people that queue up for support, they will be rewarded with chests and key fragments simply by playing the game. For the people that don't want to queue for support, they won't have to worry about autofill as much, so they can play what they want. 

This would also help reduce the amount of trolls in champion select, since there would be less autofill and more people would get the roles they want.

The missions will be optional, so I can't think of any reason **not** to add them

There's a different priority for each role.

Top: Absorb damage (if a tank), split lanes (if a duelist), then ward the map.
Mid: Control the battlefield (if a mage) kill enemy squishies (if assasin), then ward the map.
Jungler: Snowball lanes, take dragons, herald and baron (and yes, this involves vision control)
ADC: Do damage, then ward, but obviously they are an easy prey when doing this so they must do it carefully.
Support: Main responsability in warding and peeling for the adc. Of course, the others have to help, but the role is callled "support" for a reason.
TL,DR: Everybody in the team has to work together, but roles exist for a reason. Different champs do different things.

> Support: Main responsability in warding and peeling for the adc. Of course, the others have to help, but the role is callled "support" for a reason.

I wouldn't really say that all supports should focus on peeling for the ADC (or other carries like Cassiopeia or Kayle)
After all some supports are just as good if not better at engaging rather than just peeling and if they do engage they usually don't have the cooldowns to peel as well ({{champion:89}} {{champion:12}} )
There are also the mage supports who also deal a lot of damage ({{champion:143}} {{champion:63}})
And other supports who don't have great peeling but are strong in other ways

And some jungle/top lane tanks are pretty good at peeling
Yes it's everyone's job to be support, but since support's (should) buy a sightstone, people are MORE likely to go support to complete the quest since they have the most wards available.

Yeah but put a greedy player into the support slot and he's just going to sit back and relax watching their lane partner do all the work and then suddenly 'oops, I killed someone' or some variation of that will be their strategy instead of actually HELPING.

Now if you put a loving player into the support slot, they are going to be actively looking for ways to help out, and they are going to stay busy being a reliable teammate. Isn't that the kind of support you want in your games? I know it's the kind I want.
